alert.note: Alert for Coastal Kenedy (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 20 at 4:06AM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy expected. Very cold wind chills expected, including during the morning commute on Friday. Total accumulations of 0 are expected. Expect wind chills to range from 30 above zero to 20 above zero. * WHERE...Coastal Kenedy County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, 12 AM to 12 PM Friday. For the Wind Chill Advisory, 9 PM this evening to 12 PM Friday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning means significant amounts of ice are expected This will make travel very hazardous or impossible. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
